definition: to wake up/to be awake/to become aware/to sober up/to come to

sentences.english: When the inebriated elk was freed, it lay for a while on the ground, seemingly unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 當“醉鬼”獲救後，它在地上躺了一會，昏迷不醒。

sentences.english: Manni: What if I were in a coma, and the doc says, ′One more day?′
sentences.chinese: 如果我昏迷不醒，醫生說“只能再活一天”怎麼辦？

sentences.english: The druken man fell to the floor in a stupor.
sentences.chinese: 這個醉鬼昏迷不醒，倒在地上。

sentences.english: Qiuhua accidentally bumps into Jiazhen causing her to miscarriage.
sentences.chinese: 秋樺意外推倒佳珍，導致佳珍流產並昏迷不醒。

sentences.english: Keyboard and others later found hidden in the tree hole Huang Zhankui has been in a coma.
sentences.chinese: 李劍等人隨後找到了藏在樹洞內已昏迷不醒的黃佔魁。

sentences.english: CHA 0 means that the character is withdrawn into a catatonic, coma like stupor, helpless.
sentences.chinese: 魅力爲0時角色會因爲精神極度緊張而昏迷不醒。

sentences.english: It was a direct hit. The jug shattered into pieces over the back of his head and he fell to the ground, unconscious and bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 而且他也昏迷不醒的倒在地上，還流着血。

sentences.english: I thought I put you in a coma.
sentences.chinese: 我以爲是我害你昏迷不醒。

sentences.english: He ended up in the hospital and was in a coma all night.
sentences.chinese: 結果他被送到一個醫院，整夜昏迷不醒。

sentences.english: He had inhaled some of it, and lost consciousness even as help arrived.
sentences.chinese: 他吸入了一些毒氣，直到援兵趕到時還昏迷不醒。

sentences.english: One night, China on the honor of the taxi, car crash, the two men were in a coma.
sentences.chinese: 一晚，華上了榮的計程車，車子失事，二人昏迷不醒。

sentences.english: He's been in a coma for the past six weeks.
sentences.chinese: 在過去的六個星期中，他一直昏迷不醒。

sentences.english: You know how I'm in a coma?
sentences.chinese: 你們知道我怎麼會昏迷不醒嗎？

sentences.english: Black ant treatment big sister, coma and makes big sister.
sentences.chinese: 黑蟻一邊救治大妹，一邊又施法讓大妹昏迷不醒。

definition: to lose consciousness/to be in a coma/stupor/coma/stunned/disoriented
to be delirious/to be mentally confused
to faint/to swoon/to black out/to become unconscious
to have only a breath of life (idiom)
